intro: Rhodiola krylovii, commonly known as the Siberian rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Rhodiola krylovii is known for its high concentration of secondary metabolites, including rosavins and salidrosides, which contribute to its medicinal properties. It is often cultivated for its purported adaptogenic and antioxidant benefits.
